content.raw:
Can you try with the `sim` and `bridge` docker images? Change the commands below to match your world and robot\(s\) configuration. Notice that it will take a few minutes to download the latest images.

‌

```
# Remove previous sim and bridge images first:
$ docker images | grep srf/subt-virtual-testbed
$ docker rmi -f [IMAGE_ID]

# Open terminal 1 and run cloudsim_sim:
$ cd ~/subt_ws/src/subt/docker
$ ./run.bash osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_sim_latest cloudsim_sim.ign worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1

# Open terminal 2 and run cloudsim_bridge:
$ cd ~/subt_ws/src/subt/docker
$ ./run.bash osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_bridge_latest worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1

# Open terminal 3 and run your solution, either from its catkin workspace or as a solution docker image.
```

‌
content.html:
Can you try with the sim and bridge docker images? Change the commands below to match your world and robot(s) configuration. Notice that it will take a few minutes to download the latest images.

‌

# Remove previous sim and bridge images first:
$ docker images | grep srf/subt-virtual-testbed
$ docker rmi -f [IMAGE_ID]

# Open terminal 1 and run cloudsim_sim:
$ cd ~/subt_ws/src/subt/docker
$ ./run.bash osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_sim_latest cloudsim_sim.ign worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1

# Open terminal 2 and run cloudsim_bridge:
$ cd ~/subt_ws/src/subt/docker
$ ./run.bash osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_bridge_latest worldName:=tunnel_circuit_practice_01 robotName1:=X1 robotConfig1:=X1_SENSOR_CONFIG1

# Open terminal 3 and run your solution, either from its catkin workspace or as a solution docker image.
